org.metacsp.booleanSAT

Class BooleanDomain

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.metacsp.framework.Domain
      • org.metacsp.booleanSAT.BooleanDomain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>

    public class BooleanDomain
extends Domain
    Represents domains for BooleanVariables, namely the set {T,F}. ValueChoiceFunctions for this domain are dynamically managed by the BooleanSatisfiabilitySolver, which guarantees the existence of a ValueChoiceFunction named "modelX" for each model X in {0 ... maxModels-1} of the current ConstraintNetwork. Note that the ConstraintNetwork is never left in an inconsistent state, therefore the ValueChoiceFunction called "model0" is always defined.
    Author:
    Federico Pecora
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BooleanDomain

        public BooleanDomain(BooleanVariable v)
        Create a BooleanDomain for a BooleanVariable. The domain is set to {T,F}.
        Parameters:
        v - The variable of which this is a domain.

      • BooleanDomain

        public BooleanDomain(BooleanVariable v,
             boolean... values)
        Create a BooleanDomain for a BooleanVariable given a specification of its allowed values. The specification must be of size 2.
        Parameters:
        v - The variable of which this is a domain.
        values - The initial allowed values for this domain.
